alert.note: Alert for Southeast Gila County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 31 at 3:21PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Gila County through 400 PM MST... At 320 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southwest of Cedar Creek, or 32 miles southwest of Show Low, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of Gila County. This includes US Highway 60 between mile markers 295 and 298. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
